page.title: 14ECOLOGY IN NORTH FAREHAM
page.content: BIRDS There is a large population of all the common British birds;sparrows, starlings, blackbirds,thrushes and tits.The quiet rural nature of the area ensures a large number of less common birds. Magpies are frequently seen in pairs in the hedgerows; yellowhammers and wrens nest among the hawthorns and swallows and swifts feed along the rivers.The grassland and cereals provide a hiding place for the nests of skylarks,as well as a ready larder of fieldmice for the hunting kestrels. A heron was observed fishing along the river Wallington but it's nest was not discovered.There is a large colony of both rooks and crows in the copse.
